node.title: It's home to 37 government departments, but this tiny island's residents are still sick and homeless
node.alt: A Torres Strait Islander man and woman sit on a couch in a house
node.description: Thursday Island is the administration centre of the Torres Strait, but underneath all that administration and bureaucracy residents say their lives are a daily struggle.
node.content:
["Thursday Island is a pulsing hub of public service servicing the Torres Strait, but underneath all that administration and bureaucracy there is a festering problem.", "The island \u2013 known by its traditional name Waiben\u00a0\u2013 emerged as the administrative and strategic centre of the remote archipelago during WWII.", "Waiben's original inhabitants, the Kaurareg people, were forcibly removed to Moa Island the early 1920s, but the island remains an important service centre for Torres Strait Islanders \u2013 who make up about a quarter of Thursday Island's population.", "It is a tight squeeze, with 37 federal and state government departments and their workers sharing a four-square kilometre island.", "The result is widespread homelessness and overcrowded housing among Thursday Island's Indigenous populations, with government housing occupying more than half of the island.", "Health authorities say the situation has led to the region having the highest rate of rheumatic heart disease in the country \u2013 a condition with links to overcrowded housing.", "While many public servants are offered subsidised rent, local people are being forced to pay mainstream rent in an inflated and unrealistic economy.", "The sad reality is many will never own their own home, with the few properties on the market well out of range price-wise for local people.", "Now, community leaders are trying to take charge and change the situation from within.", "", "
Thursday Island is only about four\u00a0square kilometres in size, but hosts 37 government departments.(ABC Far North: Brendan Mounter)
", "
Local worker living in women's shelter
", "On the night the ABC met Thursday Island residents Joe Passi, 32, and Ayesha Kepa, 34, had just finished work as lifeguards for the day \u2014 about\u00a08pm.", "The couple were born on Thursday Island and grew up in the Torres Strait, and both work full-time.", "They have also been homeless for seven years.", "Ms Kepa has lived in a women's shelter for more than a year with two of her children.", "\"I just get a room,\" she said.", "\"The only private thing I have is my room \u2014 that's about it.\"", "Mr Passi had been sleeping in a relative's loungeroom.", "\"It's been rough, very rough, sleeping on the couch,\" he said.", "\"I do have a bed now in the loungeroom, but I think that couch surfing is not for anyone.", "\"But it is what it is\u00a0\u2014 can't do nothing about it. Just keep on going,\" he said.", "", "
Ayesha Kepa has been living in a women's shelter with two of her children for more than a year.(ABC Far North: Brendan Mounter)
", "The couple are aware of the constant flow of public servants to and from the island.", "\"It's kind of frustrating when you see a family move up,\" Ms Kepa said.", "\"They have a mother [who] probably works at the hospital as a doctor and then the husband will come [and] do a solid three years as a construction worker.", "\"You'll have them staying in a state government housing, subsidised with rent and electricity.", "\"They probably already have a house back down in the city, paying it off while back up here.", "\"Maybe we should work for state government!\" Mr Passi jokes.", "
Widening the gap
", "Torres Shire Mayor Vonda Malone says the disparity between\u00a0access to housing and rent is creating a two-tiered society on the island.", "\"We should be moving towards closing the gap, not widening the gap,\" she said.", "\"With the imbalance that we have now, it has definitely created that.\"", "Cr Malone said overcrowding had increased over the past couple of years.", "She said it was common to see scenarios where there were people living with families or in shelters, but not on the streets.", "", "
Mayor of the Torres Shire Council,\u00a0Cr Vonda Malone, says\u00a0government housing is not charged\u00a0council rates.(ABC Far North: Brendan Mounter)
", "She said council was\u00a0also missing out on income on its freehold land, because government housing did\u00a0not pay rates.", "Cr Malone said departments should consider how many on-the-ground workers were really necessary.", "\"If you don't actually have to have a bums on seats, you can have someone work remotely,\" she said.\u00a0\"COVID has also shown us that.\"", "", "
Ned David\u00a0says\u00a0the housing situation is widening the gap of Indigenous disadvantage in the region.(ABC Far North: Brendan Mounter)
", "Ned David is the chair of Gur a Baradharaw Kod Land and Sea Council, the peak body of Registered Native Title groups in the Torres Strait, which is pushing for the creation of an independent housing authority.", "\"You can pay $600 a week,\u00a0as opposed to someone accessing the same house or the same type of dwelling as a government staff employee, paying $60,\" Mr David said.", "\"So\u00a0there you have it,\u00a0this incredible gap.", "He said GBK was\u00a0pushing for a rent-to-buy program, because families were\u00a0trapped in rental housing for generations, with no option to buy.", "\"If you don't change what we're doing, I think we'll be renters forever\u00a0\u2014 something that no one wants.\"", "
Chronic disease a result of overcrowding
", "", "
Dr Allison Hempenstall says the Torres Strait has the highest rate of rheumatic heart disease in Australia.\u00a0(ABC Far North: Brendan Mounter)
", "The Torres Strait has the highest prevalence of rheumatic heart disease (RHD) in Australia\u00a0\u2014 a chronic disease which results in regular hospital treatment and decreased life expectancy.", "It is passed through the Streptococcus A bacteria, which causes throat and skin infections, and can cause long-term damage to joints, brains and hearts.", "The more people there are in a dwelling, the higher the risk of coming into contact with the bacteria, catching or passing on the disease.", "Dr Allison Hempenstall,\u00a0a senior medical officer with the Torres and Cape Hospital and Health Service, said the\u00a0Torres Strait had\u00a0\u00a0the highest rates of rheumatic heart disease in Australia.", "\"We know that individuals with rheumatic heart disease have increased risk of morbidity and mortality with decreased life expectancy,\" she said.", "Meanwhile, Mr Passi and Ms Kepa see\u00a0their situation as unsustainable and they are considering moving back to the mainland.", "\"That's been playing on our mind for the past six months, but why should we move out of our communities?\" Mr Passi said.", "\"It's a slap in the face, especially to us\u00a0because we're the next generation\u00a0and we're not getting looked after,\" Ms Kepa said.", "
Departments respond
", "In a statement, a spokesman for the Department of Housing said creating pathways to home ownership was a key action outlined in the\u00a0Queensland Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Housing Action Plan 2019-2023.\u00a0", "It said construction of 107 new social homes would\u00a0begin before 2025 across Far North Queensland, which includes Cairns, Cape York and the Torres Strait.\u00a0", "\"As new public housing opportunities are discovered within Thursday Island, these will be assessed and included in the program where appropriate,\" the statement read.\u00a0", "Meanwhile, Queensland's Department of Energy and Public Works, which owns 217 of the government employee accommodation facilities\u00a0on Thursday Island, said while properties were not charged rates,\u00a0it contributed more than $1.36 million to the Torres Shire Council between 2015 and 2020.\u00a0", "It said average weekly rent for government-owned accommodation on Thursday Island was $875 per week \u2014\u00a0but that was subsidised if an employee was more than 50 kilometres from their usual home \u2014\u00a0deeming local residents ineligible for subsidies.\u00a0"]
